line.en: Birds that fly in the sky can't possibly\nunderstand the feelings of humans who crawl\nacross the land.

Ever since I was small, my friends have been
jealous of me: 'It must be so nice to have such a
big family.' 'I wish I'd been born into such a
rich family.
Sometimes they were even angry at me for no good\nreasons, and at times things were even a little\ndangerous for me.
'Why was I born into this family at all?'
My house was no good to me at all.
I loved my parents, and my sister, and my\ngrandfather, and everyone, but...

'My parents don't come home much, so I'm lonely,
and more than anything, it's just so hard with
everyone around me being so sparkling, excelling
at everything...'
The Kazato family was blessed with genius,\ntalent, and money.
It wasn't at all like the worn-out literary theme\nof the talentless people with only money keeping\nthem on top.
It was more like a family of superheroes from a\nHollywood movie.
And so I was miserable.
I wasn't super at all. I was just pitiable.

'I'm so glad we've got someone like Asa around,
or I'd think that the whole Kazato family was
nothing but geniuses, and then I'd look so
stupid!'
I was hurt by thoughtless remarks like my aunt's.
'Yoru seems more like the older sister, doesn't\nshe?'
Really hurt by her thoughtless remarks.
'Ahaha, good for her.'
And even more hurt by myself, laughing to keep\nthe peace.
But I felt just a little bit better about myself\nwhen I realized that at least one person in the\nfamily had less grace than I did...
And then I felt worse about myself for thinking\nthat.
No matter how hard I tried, how hard I studied, I\nwas just average.
So I stopped trying so hard. I'd learned so\nyoung, that you just can't beat the unbeatable.
Not my dazzling and decadent parents. And not...\nmy sister.
Why was a person like me even born into a family\nlike this?

I didn't want to be the daughter of a famous
scientist or the granddaughter of the school's
chairman. It would have suited me better to be
born to a more normal family.
It was difficult to breathe.
The older I got, the more air my body needed to\nsurvive, and finding the breath just kept getting\nharder.
So here, in the place my grandfather lent me, I\nstopped to catch my breath.
I gathered my thoughts, and my feelings...
After waiting for a good time to talk, Yoru\njoined me.
'Um, Sis... I quit all my lessons too.'
'It wasn't any fun doing them alone without you.'
Piano, tea ceremony, horseback riding, ballet...
I couldn't do any of them well, so I quit them\nall.
'But you were so good at them. What a waste.'
'...None of them were worth much of anything to\nme.'
So I wanted to find a hobby that Yoru couldn't\nbeat me at, that Yoru wouldn't even be interested\nin, a hobby all of my own.
I wanted to reach the sky, as I'd dreamed of all\nmy life.
'I'd rather spend more time with you, Sis.'
And yet Yoru still wholeheartedly believed in me.
'Why do you like me so much, Yoru?'
'Because you have what I don't. Besides, I don't\nneed a reason to like someone.'
I was jealous of Yoru, but I loved her.
...If Yoru really did have feelings for Aoi...
Then why did I fall in love too?
'Sis, you look sad again. Cheer up! I don't know\nwhat's bothering you, but if you want to tell me,\nI'll listen!'
'Yeah... Thanks.'
Birds that fly in the sky can't possibly\nunderstand the feelings of humans who crawl\nacross the land.
Because birds have wings.

Despite the spot of trouble along the way, with
Kanako's and Yoru's help, we were soon able to
get back on schedule for the glider's
reconstruction.
In fact, we even got a bit ahead of schedule\nagain.
Everything was going smoothly again.
...Or at least it seemed that way.
'Asa?'
'Wha?!'
'You've seemed lost in thought a lot lately. Is\nthere something wrong?'
'N, no! It's nothing!'
But Asa was acting just a little odd again.
She didn't seem extremely dark or depressed, but\nshe got oddly quiet and thoughtful all the\ntime...
It seemed that way to me.
'...Are you okay?'
'Y- yes! I'm really fine!'
Well, if she really was okay...
'Hmmm... Doesn't Asa seem just a little bit\nstrange lately?'
'You think so too, Kanako?'
Apparently it wasn't just me.
'She must have a lot of things to think about.\nThat's youth for you.'
'Well, she's about that age, right? Unlike you\nand Aoi, Asa seems rather delicate.'
'What do you mean by that, Ageha? Are you trying\nto say that we have no delicacy?!'
'Now that you mention it, she's acting strange\ntoo.'
'Ageha, where should I attach this?'
'Just look at that. Since when has she been so\nserious about this?'
'It's a good thing, don't you think?'
'It may be good but it makes me nervous! Did she\neat something dangerous or something?'

'Until just recently, she was saying all those
buzz-killing things like 'I can't participate in
something so pointless' and 'What's the point of
flying in the sky?''
'So why is she so cooperative all of the sudden?'
'Does it matter? Yoru's helping us now, so let's\njust be thankful.'
'It's just as he says, Tori. Someone more skilled\nthan you is helping you out now, so stop being so\njealous.'
'Aaaaaaaaah, who do you think you are?!'
'Oh dear, Bird Head's angry again.'
'Who's a Bird Head?!'
'Those two are really getting along well lately,\naren't they?'
'Yeah.'
They fit each other perfectly, or perhaps it was\nthe opposite.
'But I do think Yoru's been a bit strange lately\ntoo.'
'Really?'
'Yeah, kinda. Maybe it's just my imagination. But\nshe's also at the age that gets worries and stuff\neasily.'
Kanako was close with those two, and she was a\ngirl too, so maybe she understood them more than\nI did.
But I had noticed...
'Hmm... This is hard to do by myself...'
'Yoru, can I help you?'
'Kanako, could you please give me a hand here?'
'Okay!'
It seemed that I was being avoided.
'Aoi, did you do something to make Yoru hate\nyou?'
'No, I don't remember anything like that.'
'Sexual harrassment or something?'
Hmmm...
'Aoi, you really should work harder to get along\nwith your juniors.'
'Like you have any right to talk.'
After club, when I'd come back to the dorm, I\nstarted getting ready for the next day.
A typhoon was expected tomorrow afternoon, so I\nstarted preparing for that.
I brought in some equipment from outside and put\nit away where it would be safe.
Had I really done something to make Yoru hate me?
I can't think of anything like that.
...But now that I thought of it, Asa seemed to be\navoiding me a bit lately too.
She used to be so upfront about asking to help\nwith cooking and stuff, but she'd stopped doing\nthat...
'Aaaaaooooooiiii!'
Hug!
'Uwaaaaaaaah!!'
'Wh, what was that for, screaming when I hug\nyou?! That's so rude!!'
'Oh, it's you, Kanako...'
'What am I relieved for.'
When I turned around, I saw Kanako...
In her underwear.
'Please don't just grab me so suddenly. It's bad\nfor my heart!'
'It wasn't sudden at all. I called your name\nfirst, right? But you didn't notice me.'
'So I hugged you.'
'...Anyway, don't grab me. And please put on some\nclothes. And why are you in your underwear\nanyway?'
It was still before dinner, so she probably\nhadn't just taken a bath.
'Because it's hot?'
'...Don't go around in your underwear just\nbecause it's hot. I'm a guy, okay?'
'It's because there's a guy around that I'm in my\nunderwear in the first place!'
'Could you please cut it out with the sexual\nharrassment?'
It was really a pain!
'I'll help you find the tartar sauce.'
'Why are you trying to strip me?!'
She was like a dirty old man...
'Okay, I'll stop teasing you now.'
'So you were teasing me, after all...'
'Are you going through puberty pains too, Aoi?'
'Huh?'
'You were staring off into the sky just now. What\nwere you thinking about so deeply that you didn't\neven notice me approach?'
'Was it Asa and Yoru?'
'Uhh, err...'
Kanako was unexpectedly observant. How had she\nknown?
'I just feel like they don't like me anymore, and\nthey're ignoring me.'
'Mmhmm.'
'I wonder if I really did do something to make\nthem hate me. But I don't know when or how.'
'Yeah, could be. You are pretty insensitive at\ntimes.'
'Eh? Really?'
'You didn't realize? Giving us Szechuan tofu for\nbreakfast and stuff...'
'Aaah... Yeah, I still make mistakes like that,\ndon't I...'
I didn't do it as much as I used to, but I'd\ndefinitely made the mistake of serving much too\nhearty meals for breakfast.
I'd thought Szechuan tofu was healthy, but...
'But I really don't think they hate you...'
'I wonder.'
'After all, the atmosphere between the two of\nthem is getting pretty awkward lately too.'
'They're not hanging out together as much. And\nYoru used to stick to Asa like glue.'
'Now that you mention it...'
It was true. Recently Yoru hadn't really been\nfollowing Asa around much.
And Asa also seemed to be making less effort to\ntalk with Yoru.
'Anyway, the easiest thing to do would be to ask\nthem, right?'
'I guess so, but they won't tell me.'
I'd actually already tried to talk to Asa several\ntimes.
I wanted to know what was bothering her, or if\nanything was really bothering her at all.
But she'd just shake her head and insist that it\nwas nothing.
...It sure didn't look like nothing.
'Yeah, they wouldn't tell me either. I've\nactually asked them several times.'
'So it's no good.'
Even Kanako had tried to talk to them.
There was no reason for me to feel that way, but\nsomehow hearing that made me happy.
'Anyway, it's not very nice to bother them so\nmuch about something they don't want to talk\nabout.'
'Yeah.'
I'm sure if they felt like talking, they'd come\nand say something themselves.
I felt like I should just wait for that.
'At any rate, I'll do what I can to help.'
'And what's that?'
'A secret'
Kanako gave me a devilish smile, and then left\nthe living room.
'I may just have to jump in and help!'
What was she up to?
'(It's been like this ever since that day...)'
'(It's been a little awkward with Yoru, and of\ncourse with Aoi...)'
'(... It's hard to breathe...)'
'...Hey, Sis.'
'...Yeah?'
'Dinner was good tonight, wasn't it?'
'...Yeah, it was.'
'(I don't really remember what it tasted like.)'
'(Yoru seems to feel awkward too. Uugh... What is\nthis weird feeling?)'
'(Now that it's gotten like this, it's hard to\nfind a way to get back to normal. It really is\nsuffocating...)'
'H, hey, Yoru. Did you know there's supposed to\nbe a typhoon tomorrow?'
'Y, yeah. I know.'
'(What is this? It's hard to talk to Sis\nface-to-face.)'
'(And the same with Aoi. Why? I don't have any\nreason to feel so...)'
'(Is there something I haven't noticed? What is\nit?)'
'(Do I... Could I really...)'
'(... No way, that can't be!)'

'(At any rate, Sis comes first. I've got to get
things back to normal with her. For some reason
everything's all uncomfortable with her, and I've
got to find something to fix that...)'
'(We've always gotten along until now. Uuugh,\nwhat should I do?)'
Knock knock
'Huh? Who could it be? ...Yes?'
Click
'Hey there, you two!'
'Hi Kanako. What is it?'
'I just felt like stopping by to see you! How are\nyou doing?'
'...Well enough, I suppose.'
'I see. I thought you two seemed a little off\nlately, so I came to try to cheer you up. Was\nthat a mistake?'
'It's okay. At least, in my case there's\nnothing-'
'Hey, I've got a little bitty plan.'
'To get rid of your gloomy feelings. Why don't\nyou try something fun?'
'Something you'd never do normally.'
'Something... fun...?'
'Right. I don't know what's eating at the two of\nyou, and you don't have to tell me if you don't\nwant to.'
'But I still think you'll feel better if you do\nsomething fun, okay?'
'Aren't you kind of meddling?'
'(Sort of like Aoi...)'
'Nah, I just don't wanna see my cute juniors\nfeeling so blue! It makes me feel sad too, you\nknow?'
'(Yeah, she seems a lot like him...)'
'...What kind of plan is it?'
'You switch places! The two of you!'
'Why should we do a think like that?'
'I'm not completely sure, but it seems like the\ntwo of you aren't quite sure how to interact with\nthe people around you.'
'And you're wondering what to do about it. Am I\nwrong?'
'...But then why should we switch places?'
'Because it'll be fun! And it'll get everyone\ninvolved.'
'If you two pretend to be each other, you'll\nstill have to talk to everyone else, right?'
'And if you manage to fool everyone, we can all\ntalk it over after you've revealed the trick!'
'With Aoi, too, of course.'
'So what do you think? It's just my idea to shake\nthings up a bit since the two of you seem kinda\nsad lately...'
'Come on, maybe you'll have so much fun your\nworries will disappear!'
'And actually, I've been wanting you to do this\nfor ages! Switch places!'
'So that's your real reason.'
'Heh heh!'
'(She's half playing around and half meddling.\nBut it does sound a bit interesting...)'
'(It's a plan she made out of worry for us, so\nit's hard to turn down. And...)'
'(But while things are this strained with Sis, I\ncouldn't possibly...)'
'...That sounds fun.'
'Oh, you're interested, Asa?'
'I think I might be willing to give it a try.'
'(And if I switch places with Yoru, I can find\nout how Aoi acts around her.)'
'(...But why do I even want to know these\nthings?)'
'What about you, Yoru?'
'(If Sis is okay with it, I guess I don't have to\nrefuse. And I'm sick of this awkwardness.)'
'(If we do something stupid like this, we might\nbe able to go back to normal afterwards.)'
'(And this type of thing reminds me of old\ntimes.)'
'I'll do it.'
'Oh, alright!!'
'(Even if I'm wrong, I want to ask.)'
'(Because this is how I feel now.)'
Breakfast.
'Yes?'
'...No, nothing.'
The two of them still seemed kind of distant.
And today they also seemed strangely restless.
'Um, Aoi.'
'Yes?'
'Do you... sense anything?'
'Like what?'
'...Never mind.'
Wh, what...?
Yoru seems angry for some reason.
'...Hee hee!'
'What are you laughing about, Kanako?'
'No reason...'
'...I think you're up to something.'
That was a suspicious laugh.
'Now, I wouldn't do anything to worry about!'
Actually...
'Kanako, how did that thing go, that you\nmentioned yesterday?'
I remembered that she'd said she was going to do\nsomething for Asa and Yoru last night.
'Hmm? What are you talking about?'
She was definitely up to something.
'Hey, Little Kazato, can you pass the soy sauce?'
'...Yoru? Kotori's talking to you.'
'Ah, aaah, I'm s, ... Sorry.'
'...Here. There you go.'
'? Thanks.'
'What is it, Kotori?'
'I still think she ate something weird...'
'Huh? Why?'
'Well, she passed me the soy sauce!'
'...Of course she passed it to you.'
'It's strange... And there was a strange pause\nthere, just now.'
How much did Yoru usually hate you, Kotori?
'Asa, can you hand me the tissues, please?'
'Yes, Ao-'
'Yes, the tissues, right?'
'?! Y, yeah. Thanks.'
Why did she answer so loudly...?
'...I, I'm sorry.'
'Hmm, the thrill is already gone. They're doing\nwell.'
As we were walking from school, Kanako suddenly\nspoke up.
'Hmm? What do you mean?'
'Oh nothing, just talking to myself.'
Kanako was looking at Asa and Yoru as she spoke.
'Is it something to do with what you said\nyesterday?'
'Mmm, maybe. Perhaps it is.'
Kanako avoided the question.
And today she was joining us at Soaring Club.
'(It's true that when I'm concentrating on this,\nI don't have time for worrying...)'
'(I'm too busy just figuring out how to behave.\nMy worries have been replaced by more stressful\nthings!)'
'(She may have had ulterior motives, but this was\na pretty good idea Kanako had.)'
'(Aoi hasn't noticed... Right? I hope he\nhasn't...)'
'(But it's a little lonely to think he hasn't\nnoticed, too...)'
'Umm... Kotori?'
'Yeah?'
'Have you... noticed anything?'
'...Noticed?'
'No, never mind.'
'...What is it? Are you teasing me again?'
'Ah, no, it's not that...'
'You are teasing me! Even though you're just a\nyounger sister.'
'...You're a younger sister too, you know.'
And either way, how is 'younger sister' an\ninsult?
'Hey. The typhoon is supposed to hit this\nevening, right? What time should we come home\nfrom the club?'
'Uh, let's just look for a good stopping place in\nthe early evening. We don't wanna get stuck away\nfrom home. Is that okay, Kotori?'
'Yeah. Let's go with that.'
'Okay!'
'Hey, Little Sis.'
'Yeah?'
'...This is just like old times, isn't it?'
'Yeah. I never thought we'd do it at this age,\nbut... I think I'm finally getting used to it\nagain.'
'What are you used to?'
'...Nothing. It's private.'
'You really are weird today.'
'I may be a bit weird today... But less so than\nyou are every day, Tori.'
'Never mind, she's normal!'
'Yoru, you shouldn't fight with Kotori so much,\nokay?'
'Yup, doing great.'
'What is it, Kanako?'
'Sorry, nothing!'
Kanako had had a frightening smile on her face\nfor a while now.
...But more than that...
Something seemed odd.
There was just something a little off...
And this morning, Yoru had asked me if I sensed\nanything.
What could she mean?
'Hey, Yoru.'
'Yes? What is it?'
'Did you... cut your hair?'
'No, I haven't.'
'Hmm, then did you... No, you haven't changed\nyour hair style.'
'Nope, I haven't.'
Hmmm... Then what was it?
Makeup... No, she's not wearing any.
'I changed my soul.'
'Wha?!'
'It's a joke.'
That's a pretty weird joke.
'Oh, hey everyone!'
We met up with Ageha.
'Hello, Ageha.'
'Glad to see that everyone looks happy toda- eh?\nWhat's this?'
'What is it, Ageha?'
'No, sorry. It's just my imagination... I think?'
It looked like Ageha also noticed something odd\nabout the twins.
There was definitely something strange going on\nwith them.
Did they get new hair accessories?
No, it didn't look like it. Hmm...
'Hey, Asa. I've got a favor to ask.'
'Yes?'
'Alright! Perfect, even when spoken to!'
'Hmm? What are you saying, Kanako?'
'Huh? Eh? No, nothing. Hahaha!'
Of course I was curious.
'Can you pull on this for me please?'
'No, I don't want to. Do it yourself, Tori.'
'Wha? What's wrong, Kotori? I'll help!'
Something was definitely up.
'Hmm, this is a problem.'
'What's wrong?'
'Well, it's not a big deal. But we don't have\nenough garbage bags.'
We'd been going through an awful lot of garbage\nbags lately.
If we didn't keep track of them closely, we'd run\nout all the time.
'Okay, should I go buy some?'
'Huh? You don't need to go out of your way for\nthat.'
'It's okay, I'll just buy them and come right\nback. It won't take long. And I'm out of things\nto do here anyway.'
'Hmm? Really? Okay, thanks.'
'Ah... I, Can I go too?'
'Hmm? Sure, that's fine, but... Huh?'
Yoru wanted to come...?
'Uh, umm... I thought you might be lonely going\nby yourself, so I thought I'd come along. Is that\na problem?'
'Ah... Yeah, come along then.'
I really hadn't expected to hear Yoru say\nsomething like that.
But there were some other things I wanted to buy\ntoo, as long as there were two of us to carry\nthem, so it was really a help to have her along.
'...Anyway, I just felt like coming.'
Hmm. I couldn't shake this odd feeling.
Normally Yoru would never volunteer to come along\non an errand like that.
I wondered what she was up to.
'...Don't you think you're acting just a little\ndifferent?'
'Eh? In what way?'
'I guess it could just be my imagination...'
'I- I think it is. I don't know what you're\ntalking about!'
Hmmm... Maybe I should just believe her.
'Umm, so, where are we going?'
'Hmm, well, we may as well go to a supermarket to\npick up some cheap ones. There's one really close\nby.'
'Okay, got it.'
...I must have just been imagining it.
'Now that you mention it, you first met Sis at\nthat supermarket, right?'
'Hmm? Yeah.'
'A lot of stuff has happened since then.'
'Yeah, quite a bit. After all, it's been a year.'
'Right. And today there's gonna be a typhoon.\nThere was a typhoon on the day Sis and I moved\ninto Flying Fish Manor, too.'
'Aah, now that you mention it, there was. What a\ncoincidence.'
A whole year.
I saw Asa buying ingredients for curry at the\nsupermarket, and then saw Yoru the next day...
'By the way, you like noodles with dip, right?'
'I seem to remember that the first time I met\nyou, you said you liked them.'
'No, the one who likes that is...'
'Hm?'
'No, uh, nothing.'
Yoru seemed to be stumbling over her words.
'Yes, that's right. It's me.'
'That's what I thought. I thought I might be\nremembering wrong.'
'...But Sis doesn't like that much. She likes\nspicy things, but she's not too fond of oily\nthings...'
'Hmm.'
'I like sweet and oily things.'
'...Then I guess you're a little more feminine in\nthat respect.'
'Eh?'
'Well, you know, girls have a reputation for\nliking sweets and meat... It's just a stereotype,\nbut still.'
'...I see. Maybe so.'
'Yoru?'
'No, nothing. I'm just happy you called me\nfeminine.'
'Ah, I, I see.'
'But wow. You and Asa really do like totally\nopposite things.'
'That's right. We've always been that way.'
We'd talked about that once before.
They looked so much alike, but their interests\nwere polar opposites.
'So I've always fought with Sis about stuff like\nthat. Like about whether mushrooms or bamboo are\nbetter.'
'Huh. I didn't think you fought much.'
'Well, not all the time, and they were just silly\nlittle arguments anyway.'
'You know how kids are, always wanting to prove\nto others that their own likes and dislikes are\ncorrect.'
'Yeah, I guess you're right. It's not that I\ndon't understand it.'
And they were older now.
'So we argued about stuff like that sometimes.'
'Hmm.'
'And that's why I thought it would be okay.'
'Okay?'
Yoru stopped talking for a moment.
She seemed to be thinking about something.
'Well, about various things.'
'Anyway, Aoi, let's get that shopping done.'
'Ah, okay.'
We bought the garbage bags and headed back\ntowards the dock.
We also bought some juice and paper cups for\neveryone, so our bags were pretty heavy.
I didn't want to make Yoru carry too much, so I\njust gave her the garbage bags and plastic cups,\nand carried the two bags of drinks myself.
Hmm, I kept thinking so while we were shopping,\nbut...
Yes, it was definitely strange.
It was as though the person in front of me wasn't\nreally Yoru. Like an illusion.
'Um, Yoru. Today you seem a bit...'
'Er, Aoi, I have a question...'
I was about to ask Yoru a question, but she spoke\nover me.
'What do you think of me, Aoi?'
'Eh?'
'...I mean, how do you feel about me?'
How did I feel?
'What kind of a question is that?'
'Just what I said. What do you think about me?\nHow do you feel about me?'
Why all of the sudden...?
'Why do you ask?'
'...Because I want to ask. Is there something\nwrong with that?'
Was she just curious?
...It was embarrassing, but it wouldn't really\nhurt me to answer.
'I think you're really cool, Yoru. And really\ntalented.'
'Cool...'
'You seem to be able to do anything, and you're\nsmart, and you know what you want. ... And\nsometimes you're really cute.'
'I think you're a great girl.'
My own words sounded incredibly embarrassing to\nme.
...But that's just because I answered honestly,\nso I guess it couldn't be helped.
But really, why was she asking that...?
Could it be...
No, definitely not. But...
I started to imagine something really sweet, but\nthat was just overthinking things, wasn't it?
If I let myself think that, I'd be really\nembarrassed to remember it later.
'And what do you think of Sis?'
'Asa?'
'...Yeah.'
Asa...
She worked so hard, but also worried a lot, and\nmade me feel like I couldn't abandon her.
'...Like a younger sister, I guess?'
'A younger sister?'
'Yeah. She's cute, and I sometimes worry about\nher, and always want to help her. So she's kind\nof like a little sister.'
'I guess... that's how I think of her.'
'So you don't really see her as a girl, right?'
'Eh?'
'A little sister and a girl are pretty\ndifferent.'
A little sister and a girl?
'So Yoru's a girl, and I'm a little sister.\n...That's what you mean, right?'
'Huh? Wha?'
Girl? Sister?
And what did she mean 'I'm a little sister.' The\none in front of me was Yoru... Right?
Yoru suddenly grabbed my face, and brought her\nown close to mine.
'Don't you know who I am?'
'Huh? But, aren't you Yoru... Ah!'
And then she put her lips on mine.
Wha? Wha?!
What? Why? She was...
She was...
She took her lips from mine, and stepped back.
And then...
'What have I...'
For some reason she seemed shocked by her own\nactions.
'I'm... sorry...!'
And then she started running, far away.
... Huh? Wha?
Why? Why did she...
I didn't understand at all. For a while I just\nstood there.
The only thing I understood was that that hadn't\nbeen Yoru. It was Asa.
